clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Three Corneal Horizontal Marking Techniques Using iTrace™

brief_summary.textblock: Before astigmatism reducing surgery, accurate corneal horizontal marking before surgery is important. Due to new corneal topographic method, iTrace™ surgical workstation, precise evaluation of corneal horizontal marking is available. In this study the investigators compared three known corneal horizontal making techniques and evaluate accuracy of each methods using iTrace™.

primary_outcome.measure: The vertical height deviation and rotational axis misalignment amount of each three marking techniques, evaluated by iTrace surgical workstation.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 10 minutes after corneal horizontal marking.
primary_outcome.description: Nasal and temporal marked spots saved in iTrace surgical workstation program.

arm_group.description: Group 3 : Horizontal slit beam assisted marker group

study_pop.textblock: Who visited professor Tae Im Kim's clinic, department of ophthalmology, Severance hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who were scheduled to have cataract surgery
- Age between 50 to 85 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- With an underlying corneal or conjunctival disorder
